name: Veggie Burger
description: Protein-packed, delicious homemade vegetarian burger made with black beans, quinoa, and vegetables.

instructions.instruction: Sauté onion and garlic in 1 tbsp olive oil for 3 minutes.
Add red pepper, cook 2 more minutes. Remove from heat, let cool.
Roughly mash half the beans with fork or blender.
instructions.tip: Don't make completely smooth, keep some texture.

instructions.instruction: In large bowl, combine mashed beans, whole beans, quinoa, and cooled vegetables.
Add egg, breadcrumbs, and spices. Mix well.
Divide mixture into 4 equal portions, shape into patties.
Refrigerate patties for 10 minutes to firm up.
Heat remaining olive oil in pan over medium heat.
Cook patties 4-5 minutes per side until golden brown.
instructions.tip: Don't flip too often, they may break.

instructions.instruction: Place cheese slices on top during last minute, let melt.
Assemble with lettuce on bottom, patty, tomato on top. Close and serve.

tips: For vegan version, use flax egg instead of regular egg.
Patties can be frozen before cooking.
Can also cook on grill pan or in oven.
storageInfo: Uncooked patties keep 2 days in fridge, 1 month in freezer.
servingSuggestion: Serve with sweet potato fries or coleslaw.
variations: Spice bomb: Add chipotle and jalapeño.
Mediterranean: Add feta cheese and sun-dried tomatoes.
